The Briefing: Reddit Passes Snap
emails.body: %title% The Briefing By Martin Peers Nov 5, 2024 The Information is hosting an event on the impact of AI on the IPO market in San Francisco on November 14th, with speakers from NYSE, Citi and J.P. Morgan. How is the IPO market shaping up for tech and what will AI’s impact be? More details & request an invite here.Greetings!You’re likely distracted right now by election results, which have surely started rolling in as you’re reading. Rather than add to all the premature speculation on the topic, we think creating an election-free zone would be more useful. Below we recommend some things you can do tonight other than watch the news channels.Before we get to that, consider this fascinating factoid: A 12% rally today lifted Reddit’s market capitalization to $21.5 billion. That makes Reddit more valuable than Snap, which has four times as many users and four times as much revenue. (See our True Value analysis on Reddit today).That tells you investors are a lot more confident about Reddit’s future than they are about Snap’s. And who can blame anyone for that kind of downbeat mood about the parent of the Snapchat app? Snap’s stock is today trading at just over $12 a share, compared with its IPO price of $17 from 2017. That dismal stock performance is mostly because Snap increasingly looks like a permanently subscale social media service. The number of U.S. users of Snapchat hasn’t grown in two years, which is a big problem given that 60% of Snap’s revenue comes from North America. Snap’s revenue growth has slowed dramatically since 2021, when it hit $4.1 billion. The company’s fourth-quarter projections imply it will finish 2024 with $5.3 billion of revenue, which means 29% growth over three years—nothing to write home about.Reddit, on the other hand, has suddenly broken out of the pack, with its daily users rising 47% over the past year and its ad revenue skyrocketing. Reddit is still small, even compared with firms like Snap. But given that Reddit is a discussion forum on all manner of subjects, from the arcane to the mainstream, its potential seems much broader than Snapchat’s. Indeed, in the next few days, you can bet more people will head to Reddit to chew over the election results than will go to Snapchat.What to Do Tonight—Other Than Watch Election ResultsIf you’re too anxious, or uninterested, to watch the election results tonight, there’s plenty else to do. Here are some ideas: There’s lots of quality TV on streaming. For instance, the latest season of “The Diplomat” on Netflix, starring Keri Russell as a U.S. ambassador to Britain who gets overly involved in British politics, is outstanding. “The Lincoln Lawyer” on Netflix is not as high quality, but it’s still fun. On Apple TV+, check out “Disclaimer” with Cate Blanchett and “Industry,” a series about investment bankers. Or you could leave the house and see a movie. My colleagues suggest “Anora,” about what unfolds when a sex worker marries a Russian billionaire’s son. And if you want to spend the evening thinking of what to buy your loved ones for the holidays, check out Air Mail’s latest gift guide. Whatever you do, stay hydrated. In Other News• OpenAI has hired Caitlin Kalinowski, who previously led hardware for augmented reality glasses at Meta Platforms, to lead robotics and consumer hardware, she said in a post on X Monday.• Casper, the once-trendy mattress seller, has been acquired by foam manufacturer Carpenter Co., marking the brand’s latest change in ownership after a rocky IPO four years ago. Terms of the transaction, which Carpenter announced last week, weren’t disclosed.Recommended NewsletterDealmaker was named the "Best in Business" newsletter for its insightful coverage of private technology and the AI hype cycle. Start receiving the newsletter here. A message from SAP It’s time to get there before your competition. It’s time to GROW with SAP. GROW with SAP is the fast start Cloud ERP to help your business build agility, control and efficiency into every operation. So you can bring out your best. Learn more New From Our Reporters ExclusiveMeta’s VR App Funding Retreat Forces Developers to Slash Staff By Sylvia Varnham O'Regan and Kalley Huang True ValueWhy Reddit’s Explosive Growth Could Last By Anita Ramaswamy ExclusiveTikTok Sees Trump Victory As App’s Best Hope By Juro Osawa and Kaya Yurieff DealsPerplexity Nears $9 Billion Valuation in Investment Led by IVP By Natasha Mascarenhas What We’re Reading Meet Elon Musk’s Fixer Walmart’s Antidote to Locked-Up Products: A Key on Your Phone Super Micro Faces Delisting

emails.body: The Information The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com/?utm_campaign=RTSU%3A+Meta%E2%80%99s+VR+App&utm_content=5933&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4033 ) November 05, 2024 Meta Platforms suspended funding for VR app developers as it re-evaluated its strategy in the past year ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/metas-vr-app-funding-retreat-forces-developers-to-slash-staff?offer=rtsu-engagement-24&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=RTSU%3A+Meta%E2%80%99s+VR+App&utm_content=5933&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4033 ), prompting some developers to slash staff. emails.subject: Happening today, Tuesday 11/5 at 9 am PT / 12 pm ET: Chat with our editors about The Information 50—2024 edition
emails.body: ( https://www.theinformation.com/events/behind-the-scenes-of-the-information-50-2024?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5917&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4020 ) Thibault, Join us today, Tuesday, November 5th, 2024 at 9 am PT / 12 pm ET for an exclusive, in-depth look at this year’s 50 Most Promising Startups ( https://www.theinformation.com/projects/the-information-50?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5917&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4020 ). Get insights directly from our senior editors, Scott Thurm, Anissa Gardizy, and Stephanie Palazzolo, as they discuss how this year’s list was curated and explore what lies ahead for these emerging leaders across nine key sectors. You’ll also hear from guest speakers Rochan Sankar of Enfabrica, Mikey Shulman of Suno, and Ankur Goyal of Braintrust, each offering their unique perspectives on the startup landscape. These conversations are exclusively for subscribers. Save 25% on your annual subscription to The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com/subscribe?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5917&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4020 ) and enjoy unlimited access to our journalism, org charts, events, newsletters, and beyond. Once you're subscribed, don't forget to RSVP ( https://www.theinformation.com/events/behind-the-scenes-of-the-information-50-2024?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5917&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4020 ) for the event. VELIZY-VILLACOUBLAY [Voir toutes les opportunités](http://bsft.us/z/2s006hb90p7l04?uid=be55a70e-518e-41b7-8384-f000f238609e&txnid=ff62ab1e-6a33-4d62-b1a0-315495554869&mid=dc002525-95ce-4ef4-833f-65c63c1a471e&bsft_ek=2024-11-05T08%3A00%3A09Z&bsft_mime_type=text&bsft_tv=25&bsft_lx=5) Gérez le statut de vos candidatures Vous avez postulé depuis votre section emploi et certaines de vos candidatures ont peut-être évolué. Pour optimiser votre recherche d’alternance, nous vous invitons à mettre à jour le statut de vos candidatures. [Gérer mes candidatures](http://bsft.us/z/250p6cbd0b4904?uid=be55a70e-518e-41b7-8384-f000f238609e&txnid=ff62ab1e-6a33-4d62-b1a0-315495554869&mid=dc002525-95ce-4ef4-833f-65c63c1a471e&bsft_ek=2024-11-05T08%3A00%3A09Z&bsft_mime_type=text&bsft_tv=25&bsft_lx=6) Vous avez déjà trouvé votre entreprise ? Voici les prochaines étapes : - Renseignez les coordonnées de votre employeur. - Nous le contacterons pour préparer votre contrat d'alternance. - Une fois votre contrat prêt, vous pourrez démarrer votre formation ! [Renseigner mon employeur](https://api.getblueshift.com/track?uid=be55a70e-518e-41b7-8384-f000f238609e&txnid=ff62ab1e-6a33-4d62-b1a0-315495554869&bsft_aaid=a265d396-7432-4eb2-9c9a-ba5eea75629e&eid=7e9b22c6-0f20-437b-be25-30137ffcc239&mid=dc002525-95ce-4ef4-833f-65c63c1a471e&bsft_ek=2024-11-05T08%3A00%3A09Z&bsft_mime_type=text&bsft_tv=25&bsft_lx=7&a=click&redir=https%3A%2F%2Fopenclassrooms.tfaforms.net%2F4958147%3Ftfa_2%3D%26utm_campaign%3Dcareer-apprenticeship-alerting-jobs-for-candidates%26utm_source%3Dblueshift%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_content%3Dmatching-job-offers-alerting) Vous avez une question ? Consultez [notre centre d'aide](http://bsft.us/web-only/z/2r016fbt0ktb04?uid=be55a70e-518e-41b7-8384-f000f238609e&txnid=ff62ab1e-6a33-4d62-b1a0-315495554869&mid=dc002525-95ce-4ef4-833f-65c63c1a471e&bsft_ek=2024-11-05T08%3A00%3A09Z&bsft_mime_type=text&bsft_tv=25&bsft_lx=8) ou écrivez-nous à info-admissions@openclassrooms.com. emails.body: 14 November _ Join us to explore new GenAI tools on OCI Oracle <https://www.oracle.com/index.html?elq_mid=259939&sh=3231232930343622303227213132353125292229243430282428332123222523&cmid=CORP241003P00015&elqTrackId=b75b0728ff3e47d68d9953b53184c828&elq=29d6464c347345e9a225f598c98213fd&elqaid=259939&elqat=1&elqCampaignId=586313&elqak=8AF5F3B913DBC3FFF1DF603F89414C73208806E58A7B2E8A078118C98760B2064C41> View this message in a Web browser <https://app.response.oracle-mail.com/e/er?elq_mid=259939&sh=3231232930343622303227213132353125292229243430282428332123222523&cmid=CORP241003P00015&s=1973398186&lid=627002&elqTrackId=5cc160c377f6468583d1e41adb10da79&elq=29d6464c347345e9a225f598c98213fd&elqaid=259939&elqat=1&elqak=8AF549E5E2D2089558713450E07357FC6C1206E58A7B2E8A078118C98760B2064C41> "Oracle Logo" Maximize Your AI Potential with OCI "oci email right" "oci email right" Leverage Generative AI for Business Transformation 14 Nov 2024 | 11:00 a.m. CET Explore AI advances, Oracle's initiatives, and how to leverage generative AI for business success Register Now <https://app.response.oracle-mail.com/e/er?elq_mid=259939&sh=3231232930343622303227213132353125292229243430282428332123222523&cmid=CORP241003P00015&s=1973398186&lid=627001&elqTrackId=e3afd7fa621e49ac95bfa2011cce8317&elq=29d6464c347345e9a225f598c98213fd&elqaid=259939&elqat=1&elqak=8AF5D4698EC7BF3B272A85280AA62543C2BA06E58A7B2E8A078118C98760B2064C41> Discover the Tools to Launch Your AI Journey Now Learn to quickly build new apps, boost existing ones, and revolutionise your business with generative AI. Join us to explore the latest advances in GenAI and how Oracle Cloud Infrastructure supports you every step of the way. In this session we will delve into Oracle's suite of AI-powered tools, be there with your questions for a very informative session. Register today <https://app.response.oracle-mail.com/e/er?elq_mid=259939&sh=3231232930343622303227213132353125292229243430282428332123222523&cmid=CORP241003P00015&s=1973398186&lid=627001&elqTrackId=d8c8a4d85d254a84b02cf8537eb6926c&elq=29d6464c347345e9a225f598c98213fd&elqaid=259939&elqat=1&elqak=8AF579E32A94355683E603DEC84FECBFFBA406E58A7B2E8A078118C98760B2064C41> Thursday, 14 November 2024 11:00 a.m. CET Featured Speaker "Pelin Ozbozkurt " Pelin Ozbozkurt Head of AI Center of Excellence Product Management Oracle is committed to promoting a corporate culture that is centered on integrity, accountability and ethical business conduct. emails.body: %title% The Briefing By Martin Peers Nov 4, 2024 The Information is hosting an event on the impact of AI on the IPO market in San Francisco on November 14th, with speakers from NYSE, Citi and J.P. Morgan. How is the IPO market shaping up for tech and what will AI’s impact be? More details & request an invite here.Greetings!What’s the cheapest stock around right now? That has to be ByteDance, the privately owned Chinese tech giant that owns TikTok. As we reported today, ByteDance lifted its first-half revenue about 35% to $73 billion, which means it is now about as big as Facebook owner Meta Platforms but growing faster. In the first half, Meta’s revenue increased 25% to $75.5 billion. And yet Meta has a market capitalization of $1.4 trillion while ByteDance’s valuation on the secondary market for private stocks is about $250 billion, according to CapLight. That’s quite a gap. If you assume ByteDance maintains the first-half growth rate in the second half, it should generate revenue of around $150 billion in 2024. That implies the company is trading at 1.7 times this year’s revenue—the kind of multiple usually awarded to a business that isn’t growing. Meta, in comparison, is trading at around 8.7 times estimated 2024 revenue, according to S&P Global Market Intelligence. Meta’s profit margins are higher than ByteDance’s, to be sure. In the first half the Facebook owner had a 38% operating profit margin, whereas we reported today that ByteDance’s operating profit margin fell to 25%, from 30% a year earlier, thanks to investments in initiatives like e-commerce. Still, that doesn’t justify the valuation gap. Some investors have already signaled they don’t think the numbers make sense. We reported in September that Lead Edge Capital founder Mitchell Green had been buying stock in ByteDance, arguing that it was “ridiculously cheap.”But Green appears to be an outlier, and for good reason. It’s hard to think of a precedent for the threat TikTok faces in the U.S. law, passed in April, which requires the company to sever its ties to ByteDance or be banned. That has cast a cloud over ByteDance’s ability to go public—which is when investors could truly cash in. The sheer uncertainty of what will happen to TikTok and when ByteDance will go public are surely the major reasons for the depressed valuation. TikTok is trying to block the law via the courts, but there’s no certainty it will win. And even a new presidential administration may not change the situation, though Donald Trump said in the summer that he was “for TikTok” because of the need to maintain competition for Meta. For investors contemplating ByteDance, this is not an easy call.NYT and NetflixHere’s an idea for The New York Times Co.: Why not spin off the newspaper’s print edition into a separate company? I’m kidding, of course: Splitting print and digital wouldn’t be practical, given that they’re different versions of the same product. But a split is the kind of thing investors might wish for as they contemplate the Times’ third-quarter earnings report today, showing digital ad and subscription revenues growing 13% to $404 million while print revenues fell 6% to $168 million. The Times has 10.5 million digital-only subscribers—many of whom are only paying for the company’s great cooking app or its games app or its sports publication, The Athletic—and just 620,000 print newspaper subscribers. In other words, the Times is now a digital media business with a runt of a print operation. If you step back, you can see parallels between this situation and that of Netflix a few years ago, when it still operated a DVD-rental business in addition to its giant streaming operation.Netflix killed off the DVD business last year. By that point, its revenue was declining 20% annually and it accounted for just 0.4% of the company’s total sales. The print edition of the Times is a long way from shrinking that much. At its current size, its revenue plays a big role in helping the Times cover its costs— which were $563 million in the third quarter—and turn a profit. To be sure, some portion of those costs relate strictly to print, but you have to bet the bulk is the newsroom.Still, at the current rate of digital growth (and print decline), at some point in the next few years the Times’ digital operation will be big enough to sustain itself without print. That’s likely when management will have to make the big decision to shutter print. Last week, the Newark Star-Ledger said it would cease printing as of Feb. 2. The Times may only be a few years away from doing the same.In Other News Palantir, which sells artificial intelligence for analyzing data, on Monday raised its full-year 2024 revenue projection for the third time this year after growth accelerated in the third quarter. Demand for its software boosted revenue 30% to $725 million in the quarter. T-Mobile agreed to pay OpenAI roughly $100 million over the next three years as part of a deal to use the startup’s technology, The Information reported on Monday. On the eve of the election, venture capitalist and San Francisco mayoral candidate Mark Farrell has agreed to pay a record ethics fine for violating rules on campaign contribution limits. Physical Intelligence, a startup developing software for robots, has raised $400 million in a round led by Jeff Bezos, Thrive Capital and Lux Capital, according to The New York Times. OpenAI, Redpoint Ventures and Bond also participated in the financing, which valued the startup at $2 billion. Recommended NewsletterThe Information Weekend covers what happens when Silicon Valley logs off—the trends and people shaping culture, technology and everything in between. Subscribe for free today. A message from SAP It’s time to get there before your competition. It’s time to GROW with SAP. GROW with SAP is the fast start Cloud ERP to help your business build agility, control and efficiency into every operation. So you can bring out your best. Learn more New From Our Reporters ExclusiveTikTok Maintains Solid First-Half Revenue Growth Despite U.S. Ban Threat By Juro Osawa and Jing Yang ExclusiveThe Generative AI Spending of 50 Companies, From Coke to Walmart By Aaron Holmes The Next President’s Tech Agenda: A Breakdown on the Tech Statements of Trump and Harris By Kate Clark What We’re Reading Wall Street Frenzy Creates Debt Market for AI Groups Buying Nvidia Chips Why $11 Trillion in Assets Isn’t Enough for Blackrock’s Larry Fink GM Software Boss on Ditching Carplay

emails.subject: Join us live tomorrow, Tuesday 11/5 at 9 am PT / 12 pm ET: Breaking down The Information’s 50 Most Promising Startups 2024
emails.body: ( https://www.theinformation.com/events/behind-the-scenes-of-the-information-50-2024?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) Thibault, Join us tomorrow, Tuesday, November 5th, 2024 at 9 am PT / 12 pm ET for an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at this year’s 50 Most Promising Startups ( https://www.theinformation.com/projects/the-information-50?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ). Get a firsthand account from our senior editors Scott Thurm, Anissa Gardizy, and Stephanie Palazzolo, on the process behind selecting this year's featured startups and have your questions answered in real time. You’ll also hear from our distinguished speakers: Rochan Sankar of Enfabrica, Mikey Shulman of Suno, and Ankur Goyal of Braintrust. Not yet a subscriber? Save 25% on your annual subscription to The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com/subscribe?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) and gain unlimited access to our journalism, org charts, events, newsletters, and more. After you subscribe, be sure to RSVP ( https://www.theinformation.com/events/behind-the-scenes-of-the-information-50-2024?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) for the event. Register for the event ( https://www.theinformation.com/events/behind-the-scenes-of-the-information-50-2024?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) ------------------------ About The Information 50 ------------------------ Each year, The Information's reporters conduct in-depth research on hundreds of startups, uncovering fresh insights to compile The Information 50—a list of promising companies with the potential to lead their industries. This list features companies distinguished by revenue, innovative business models, and strong growth prospects. While typically reserved for Pro subscribers, The Information 50 ( https://www.theinformation.com/projects/the-information-50?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) is available to annual subscribers for a limited time, after which it becomes Pro access only. Take advantage of this opportunity to explore the full list of featured startups and join our subscribers-only discussion ( https://www.theinformation.com/events/behind-the-scenes-of-the-information-50-2024?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) with our team and special guests. Unlock your access now for just $299 per year ( https://www.theinformation.com/subscribe?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ). Subscribe and join the event ( https://www.theinformation.com/subscribe?offer=q4-2024-lvs-749%2Cq4-2024-lvs%2Cq4-2024-lvs-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) Follow us X ( https://twitter.com/theinformation?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/theinformation?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) Facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/gettheinformation?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) Threads ( https://www.threads.net/@theinformation?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) Instagram ( https://www.instagram.com/theinformation?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) Sent to gting.recrutement@gmail.com ( gting.recrutement@gmail.com?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) | Manage your preferences or unsubscribe ( https://www.theinformation.com/unsubscribe?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJleHAiOjE4ODgzNTkzMDYsInN1YiI6Imd0aW5nLnJlY3J1dGVtZW50QGdtYWlsLmNvbSIsInBlcm1zIjpbImVtYWlsLXNldHRpbmdzIiwic2xhY2siXX0.jbFJPcZmfWjfjyGmt7DTtzS3zO91qlmgYVfNbiVkuXI&utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) | Help ( https://theinformation.zendesk.com/hc/en-us?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 ) The Information · One Post Street, Suite 1050, San Francisco, CA 94104 ( https://www.theinformation.com/?utm_campaign=TI+50+2024+-+Leads+-&utm_content=5896&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4000 )

emails.subject: Turbocharging software with AI: Fast, not furious
emails.body: Straight to the future Par Capgemini Par Capgemini Lisez cet article sur LinkedIn pour rejoindre la discussion Lire sur LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/turbocharging-software-ai-fast-furious-capgemini-ob4re?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BNCmzOAk7SLeFnrH0I7pbbw%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=3C5o_F8YGJ9Hw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-bwd1d4~m33chtt1~1h-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-m33chtt1-1h&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDUxZWUwYjA4YmNhZDk0MzlkYTY4NjYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjllMTFlY2NmODE2ZWE5YTgzM2M3OGM0NTcwMzU5M2UwNmVjYTgzZmQwYmFmMmFlZCwxLDE%3D As organizations increasingly embrace generative AI in software engineering, both transformative opportunities and significant risks are coming to light. Our latest research provides concrete guidance on how organizations can safely harness Gen AI’s full potential while transforming their software engineering capabilities. What's everyone saying? Gen AI is widely believed to be on the verge of driving value creation and productivity gains for organizations that embrace it at scale, potentially ending decades of stagnating productivity. Experts compare its transformative power to that of electric motors or personal computers. What do we have to say? Gen AI adoption is still in its early stages, with only 10% of organizations currently using it in software engineering, mainly for coding and UX tasks, finds our recent study, Turbocharging software with Gen AI, which surveyed 1,097 senior executives and 1,092 software professionals. However, momentum is building fast, as evidenced by the figures below. Gen AI in software, Capgemini Research Institute This enthusiasm spurs from the significant time savings Gen AI delivers in crafting documentation, writing code and scripts, debugging and testing, and project management. While the focus often centers on coding, Gen AI has applications throughout the software development lifecycle, including business requirements, UX design, maintenance, testing, and collaboration. For organizations already applying Gen AI to software engineering, productivity gains range from 7 to 18%, depending on the industry, company size, and tools employed. But while these are significant gains, productivity shouldn’t be the main motive for investing in Gen AI. Instead, it’s about how organizations reinvest the time saved and transform their culture and mindsets. The key question isn’t “when will we see this productivity boost?”, but “how?” In fact, it’s less about investing in Gen AI for its own sake, and more about mastering software engineering, elevated by AI. Many organizations recognize this and are channeling these productivity gains into innovation. Primarily, they plan to use the time freed up by Gen AI to focus software professionals’ efforts on developing new features, products, and services. Investing in people by upskilling software professionals, in both technical and broader business domains, is the next most common use of these productivity gains. Organizations are also reallocating software professionals to more complex tasks that require human perspective and deeper understanding, while assigning routine tasks to Gen AI. In short, Gen AI is prompting organizations to invest in talent. Its widespread adoption should, therefore, be an exciting prospect for workers. In fact, a majority of Gen AI users are already reporting increased job satisfaction. Gen AI in software, Capgemini Research Institute However, unchecked use of Gen AI can also expose organizations to multiple threats, especially in the early days we are currently living. The primary factors? First, a lack of appropriate tools: Less than a third of organizations have the platforms, tools, and talent prerequisites in place to implement Gen AI for software engineering. Over 60% lack a governance framework and upskilling programs for Gen AI for software, while nearly a third of the workforce is self-training. And 63% use unauthorized AI tools and solutions. These practices expose organizations to functional errors and risks (AI hallucinations, bias, etc.), security breaches, and legal issues (privacy, code leakage, intellectual property (IP) infringements, etc.). These risks highlight the urgent need for proper governance and oversight. Who's doing it right? At the Paris Motor Show in October, Jean-Vianney Chiron, Head of AI Transformation at Michelin, shared insights on how the French engineering materials manufacturer, an early adopter of Gen AI, has used it to support its software development cycle. Among the key insights? Generative AI can help retain the best talents; in fact, developers are actively requesting it, and those that have already had a taste of its impact don't want to miss out on it anymore. What's the bottom line? The good news is that organizations can take concrete actions to harness the full potential of Gen AI for software engineering by mitigating security risks, carefully selecting use cases, and putting people at the heart of this transformation. Organizations need to choose and prioritize high benefit use cases. These can include crafting literature and documentation, coding assistance, debugging and testing, identifying security vulnerabilities, modernizing code (through translation, migration, or conversion), or preparing and evaluating RFPs. To mitigate risks around security, IP, or copyright issues and code leakage, organizations should adopt a thorough risk management approach. This means conducting a risk assessment for each selected use case and involving internal legal, IP, cybersecurity, and data protection experts from the earliest stages. More generally, organizations need to proceed with caution and ensure human oversight is in place. To ensure optimal use of Gen AI, companies should transform their software organization, rethinking established processes and developing new capabilities. This might involve learning how to pair with AI to analyze output and iterate it until reaching an acceptable solution, developing and updating prompt libraries and playbooks for software teams, or addressing complex bugs that AI can’t solve or prevent. Organizations can prepare for Gen AI use by delivering technology prerequisites. This means building a repository of platforms and tools for a seamless and augmented software engineering experience, as well as privately and safely contextualizing Gen AI assistants with an organization’s own content. As of today, 48% of organizations have no standard metrics to measure the success of generative AI use in software. Organizations should adopt a measurement protocol for Gen AI involving a measurement approach, use case prioritization, metrics, team, and a well-defined process to create actionable and reliable results. Finally, people must remain at the heart of this transformation. This means organizations will have to create a learning culture, which can be achieved by providing upskilling and cross-skilling opportunities. Looking for more? Head here to learn how to integrate Gen AI across the full software lifecycle. Looking for a glimpse into what the future holds for AI in software engineering? We’ve got you covered. On a recent episode, the hosts of our Cloud Realities podcast sat down with AI business transformation expert Nicole Onuta about the growing impact of Gen AI on the software development lifecycle and how hyper-automation is fast becoming a practical reality. Tune in! And you, what are you saying? We’d love to hear about how Gen AI is transforming software engineering in your industry and your organization’s experience in the matter, whether you’re just starting to explore its potential or already seeing results. Head to the comments section below to join the discussion. emails.subject: Keep up with biggest stories from tech and finance

The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com?utm_campaign=%5Bdrip%5D+V16+All+Leads&utm_content=3167&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=208 ) ******************** Be the first to know ******************** ( https://www.theinformation.com?cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=%5Bdrip%5D+V16+All+Leads&utm_content=3167&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=208 ) Hi Thibault, Every day, countless updates from companies demand your attention. Editor's Pick: Meta’s New Strategy in AI Search
emails.body: Greetings Thibault, Kalley Huang's latest piece dives into Meta's ambitious strategy to become less dependent on Google and Microsoft. Meta's new AI-driven search engine aims to give its users real-time answers directly from the web, cutting out the need for Google Search and Bing, whi... The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com?utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) Greetings Thibault, Kalley Huang's latest piece dives into Meta's ambitious strategy to become less dependent on Google and Microsoft ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/meta-develops-ai-search-engine-to-lessen-reliance-on-google-microsoft?offer=editors-pick-2024&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ). Meta's new AI-driven search engine aims to give its users real-time answers directly from the web, cutting out the need for Google Search and Bing, which currently power Meta’s chatbot. This is a big shift, with Meta aiming to develop its own robust AI tools to deliver answers on current events and more, all through its Meta AI chatbot ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/meta-develops-ai-search-engine-to-lessen-reliance-on-google-microsoft?offer=editors-pick-2024&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ). Why it caught my eye: * Meta’s strategy marks another bold move in AI-driven search, with significant implications for competition with big tech companies. * As conversational AI gains ground, Meta’s plan highlights the broader tech shift toward owning real-time, direct information sources. * Meta’s bot has been in the works for months, hinting at Zuckerberg’s desire for increased autonomy in the AI space. This strategy underscores Meta’s need to reduce its dependence on outside tech companies ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/meta-develops-ai-search-engine-to-lessen-reliance-on-google-microsoft?offer=editors-pick-2024&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ), a theme that’s been clear for some time now. Best, Jessica Lessin Founder & Editor-in-Chief ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/meta-develops-ai-search-engine-to-lessen-reliance-on-google-microsoft?offer=editors-pick-2024&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) ******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************* Meta Develops AI Search Engine to Lessen Reliance on Google, Microsoft ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/meta-develops-ai-search-engine-to-lessen-reliance-on-google-microsoft?offer=editors-pick-2024&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) ******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************* As Meta Platforms tries to keep up with OpenAI in developing artificial intelligence, the Facebook owner is working on a search engine that crawls the web to provide conversational answers about current events to people using its Meta AI chatbot. In doing so, Meta hopes to lower its reliance on Google Search and Microsoft’s Bing, which currently provide information about news, sports and stocks to people using Meta AI, according to a person who has spoken with the search engine team. It could also give Meta a backup option if Google or Microsoft withdrew from these arrangements, according to a person who has been involved with the strategy. Subscribe and read more ( https://www.theinformation.com/subscribe?offer=editors-pick-2024&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) A message from NYSE ( https://www.theinformation.com/redirect/ad/583?source=editor-s-pick&guid=34bfc79c7f78f1d5&sent_date=2024-11-04&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) --------------------------------------------------- Hear what's next from leaders at NYSE's Tech Summit --------------------------------------------------- ( https://www.theinformation.com/redirect/ad/583?source=editor-s-pick&guid=34bfc79c7f78f1d5&sent_date=2024-11-04&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) ( https://www.theinformation.com/redirect/ad/583?source=editor-s-pick&guid=34bfc79c7f78f1d5&sent_date=2024-11-04&utm_campaign=Editors_Pick_Email+%5B&utm_content=5905&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4008 ) Technology executives, industry leaders, and investors convened in the NYSE Boardroom to engage in discussions on critical global enterprise issues including data technology, AI and cybersecurity at NYSE’s annual Tech Summit NYC. Startups Eye Goldrush in Electrolytes
emails.body: The Information The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com/?utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) Nov 03, 2024 “I haven’t been hung over in seven years,” said Jahaan Ansari, the bearded, muscled co-founder of Gainful, a New York–based startup. Ansari may be in that fortunate position partly because he has yet to hit his 30s—he’s just 29—but he also credits what Gainful sells: powdered electrolytes. Electrolytes such as calcium, sodium and potassium combine with water to help the body manage the electric charges between nerves, cells and muscles. Dehydration, caused by exercise or other activities (like, say, a three-espresso-martini lunch), pushes those electrolytes out of the body through urination. Consume an electrolyte drink, and the recovery from that dehydration speeds up. Ansari’s Gainful purveys its powdered electrolytes in spiffy black packets that come in three flavors: strawberry lemonade, tropical mango and lemon lime. (Gainful offers them with 150 milligrams of caffeine or without caffeine.) They’re sold through Gainful’s website as one-off purchases or through a monthly $30 subscription, which also includes nutrition coaching with a registered dietitian and a free month with a personal trainer over video chat. Read the full article ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/startups-eye-a-gold-rush-in-electrolytes?utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/startups-eye-a-gold-rush-in-electrolytes?utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) ********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************* Startups Eye a Gold Rush in Electrolytes ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/startups-eye-a-gold-rush-in-electrolytes?utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) ********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************* By Ashwin Rodrigues A message from Paramount+ Original Series Lioness ( https://www.theinformation.com/redirect/ad/580?source=RTSU&article_id=13898&&guid=34bfc79c7f78f1d5&source=rtsu&utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) ( https://www.theinformation.com/redirect/ad/580?source=RTSU&article_id=13898&&guid=34bfc79c7f78f1d5&source=rtsu&utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) The heart-pounding spy thriller starring Zoe Saldaña and Nicole Kidman is back. ( https://www.theinformation.com/redirect/ad/580?source=RTSU&article_id=13898&&guid=34bfc79c7f78f1d5&source=rtsu&utm_campaign=%5BREBRAND%5D+RTSU+-+Aut&utm_content=1109&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=129 ) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Season 2 returns with a new mission and a new Lioness. The series follows Joe (Saldaña) as she juggles her personal and professional life as the head of The Lioness Program, an undercover CIA operation that sends female operatives to infiltrate and dismantle terrorist groups from within. Stream the new season now, exclusively on Paramount+. ( The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com?utm_campaign=%5Bdrip%5D+V16+All+Leads&utm_content=3147&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=208 ) The Information ( https://www.theinformation.com/newsletters/?utm_campaign=%5Bdrip%5D+V16+All+Leads&utm_content=3147&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=208 ) *************************************** The news you need, direct to your inbox *************************************** As leaders, you are inundated with information and need to make quick, strategic decisions. That's why The Information invests in a wide range of newsletters to deliver and curate what's happening in real-time. Unlike more general interest newsletters, we don't dumb the news down, ensuring all our subscribers can go deep into a range of topics at a moment's notice. emails.subject: Nouvelle position de Chef de Projet DATA H/F H/F dans Paris e
Arriveras-tu à trouver ?
emails.body: # Bonjour Thibault Comme promis, voici le principal challenge (et la solution) qu'avait un des trois participants à l'immersion. Tu es prêt ? Cool. Voilà le challenge. Un des participants avait un objectif qui lui tenait à coeur : Quitter son emploi et continuer ce même métier en étant à son compte. Très bonne idée, car... ..Fini le salaire bloqué selon la grille de la convention collective, ..Fini d'avoir le patron au-dessus de lui, . ..Et fini les décisions qui n'ont aucun sens mais qu'on est obligé de suivre car le "boss" l'exige. D'ailleurs, il y a un autre gros avantage que peu de monde prend en considération, c'est la revente du business. Oui, quand tu travailles en tant que salarié pendant 20 ans, tu as une petite prime de départ. Quand tu es à ton compte, tu as un business qui peut se valoriser et se revendre entre x0,5 à x10 de ton chiffre d'affaires annuel selon le secteur d'activité. Revenons au sujet principal. Ce participant avait cet objectif clair en tête, mais avait un gros challenge : Il ne se sentait pas légitime pour se lancer à son compte. Du coup, il s'imaginait une montagne de taches et compétences à maitriser avant de se lancer, et il ne savait pas par où commencer. Ce qui est normal. Entre la comptabilité, l'administratif, la vente, le marketing, le sav client, etc. Ça fait toujours peur quand on se lance pour la première fois. En préparant sa venue et son dossier, j'ai cerné très vite son profil. Et quand il est arrivé à la maison, le déclic s'est fait rapidement grâce à cette phrase : «Pour se lancer à son compte, il n'y a pas besoin d'être parfait. Il suffit juste d'être assez bon.» A cet instant, la pression sur ses épaules à disparu. Il s'est rendu compte qu'il était bon dans son boulot (sinon le patron l'aurait déjà viré depuis longtemps au lieu de le faire évoluer en poste). Et que se mettre à son compte était l'étape suivante et logique pour révéler son plein potentiel. Il était maintenant apte à suivre l'immersion et toutes les questions liées au "Comment on gère une boite ?" "Comment on fait çi ou cela ?" "Mes premiers clients je l'ai trouve comment ?" n'étaient même plus une préoccupation, car toutes les réponses se trouvaient dans le classeur que je lui avais préparé. Si tu dois retenir une leçon de cet email Thibault C'est que pour te lancer à ton compte, tu n'as pas besoin d'être parfait dans tout. Tu dois être suffisamment bon pour que tes clients soient contents (sinon ils vont te demander des remboursements et tu ne vas pas faire long feu). Regarde autour de toi, Le monde est entouré d'incompétents et de fainéants qui font du travail bâclé à prix d'or. Des artisans qui ne savent pas bosser, des restaurants dégueulasses, je pense que tu en entends des histoires à chaque repas de famille. Donc si toi Thibault, tu es plein d'ambition et de bonne volonté. Tu as toute ta place en tant que patron ! Et pour tout le reste qui n'est pas lié à ton métier mais qui gravite autour de la vente, du marketing, etc. Ça s'apprend et c'est plus simple qu'il n'y parait. Donc ne laisse pas des chaines mentales voler plusieurs années de ta vie. Le temps est précieux. Amicalement, Jean En regardant [cette vidéo](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsDg0fYg0cBpMnKjPFM0ig/0sAXVKT_B8k5), arriveras-tu à trouver lequel de ces 3 participants avait ce problème? Envoie-moi un email pour me dire ta réponse (si tu as bon, je t'offrirai un petit cadeau). >Pour ne plus recevoir d'email de ma part et te désinscrire de la newsletter, [clique ici (désinscription immédiate).](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsE8LNl6OyHkX3OYn4KkQk/r9VbPVj5rKD6) # # Cet e-mail a été envoyé à gting.recrutement@gmail.com Vous avez reçu cet email car vous vous êtes inscrit sur Jean Carrillo. [Se désinscrire](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/un/v2/sh/1t6AVsdYhqSR1mOwTsnsYIkJ6n5KSo/Tl134Gm-MiDt) # © Jean Carrillo

emails.subject: Climate tech revolution: Industrial scale at digital speed
emails.body: Straight to the future Par Capgemini Par Capgemini Lisez cet article sur LinkedIn pour rejoindre la discussion Lire sur LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/climate-tech-revolution-industrial-scale-digital-speed-capgemini-wcche?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bw9rYdLeKQM6mxXFfRDD%2FRA%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=3W6bDl8szuFXg1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-bwd1d4~lws1keuy~8i-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-lws1keuy-8i&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDcxOWU3YjQ4ZmNjZDA0NjlmYWY4ZDYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjkxNmRjOGJmZTYwNmFmZGIzNTM1ODMzZTYzMDQzYTQ3ZWZhODMyMjk2YWFiYmRjYSwxLDE%3D Every year, the world releases nearly 40 billion tons of CO2, with emissions continuing to rise. To reverse this trend, many industries are optimizing existing processes and boosting efficiency by using less energy, water and raw materials. Just as crucial is the complementary practice of scaling up climate tech, including renewable energies, advanced batteries, clean hydrogen, carbon capture, and other low-carbon innovations. Transitioning to low-carbon technology and driving long-term change requires overhauling traditional business models. This demanding effort will only grow over time, making immediate action essential. What’s everyone saying? 35% of CO2 reductions needed by 2050 rely on technologies that are not yet commercially viable, says the International Energy Agency (IEA). Financing remains a major obstacle to scaling up these mature technologies. But there are others: we also need to speed up innovation and deployment. This is no easy task in an economy that is becoming increasingly complex as it shifts from fossil fuels to a diverse range of renewable energies. Time is running out to overcome these obstacles: “A broader and faster roll-out and scale-up of innovative climate-neutral technologies is paramount – the sooner, the better for the climate,” urges Margrethe Vestager, Executive VP of the European Commission. What do we have to say? Climate tech is the next frontier for businesses aiming to decarbonize – and a recent Capgemini Research Institute report shows many organizations are now fully aware of this. Climate tech: Harnessing the power of technology for a sustainable future However, adopting climate tech may drive up product costs: for example, producing low-carbon hydrogen is still 2 to 3 times pricier than conventional hydrogen. How much of that cost are companies ready to bear? Not much, it seems. According to the same report by the Capgemini Research Institute, firms are only willing to accept a ~9% “green premium”. Consequently, organizations plan only a modest 7.7% increase in climate tech investment over the next two years. Thankfully, technologies like AI or digital twins can help offset these costs by accelerating innovation. These solutions are a “must have” for manufacturing processes to deliver the required efficiencies. The climate tech transition is also a digital transition. Digital solutions can also optimize product performance and streamline testing and implementation processes. In this regard, another recent Capgemini study shows an integrated digital toolchain can halve the time-to-market for battery cells. Climate tech: Harnessing the power of technology for a sustainable future While climate tech adoption may come with a price tag short term, it brings substantial benefits in the long run, as a growing number of companies are already finding out. Who’s doing it right? Kouros , an emerging leader in sustainable energy transitions, recently created Hyliko, a world-class heavy mobility platform. Hyliko provides hydrogen and trucks as a service to freight transportation companies, integrating carbon-negative technology with valuable services like truck leasing and maintenance support. An innovative approach, supported by Capgemini, that greatly facilitates the shift from carbon-powered to cleaner freight vehicles. What’s the bottom line? Scaling up climate tech requires more than just reducing costs; it demands a complete rethinking of existing processes and the adoption of new habits. Just like choosing a healthier lifestyle to live longer comes with high barriers to entry, so does overhauling traditional business models and deploying climate tech on a large scale. Fortunately, we’ve identified five key ingredients you’ll need for this transformation: Balance tech with strategy. Dependable tech needs a strong business model for effective integration. Expert strategy guidance is crucial for leveraging tech to become more efficient. Out with the old, in with the new. Embrace innovative business models such as offtake agreements for financial viability and “as-a-service” models to simplify brownfield deployments. And while pilots will remain valuable, they will be created in virtual environments to reduce their costs and pave the way for faster investment and rollout. Think digital. Companies often overlook the importance of a digital-first approach. Continuous digital integration helps identify and solve production issues early, optimizing operations as technologies evolve and ensure carbon footprint calculation and traceability. Most of all, scaling up requires shortening deployment cycles, which can only be achieved with robust data, simulation and digital twin capabilities. Collaborate with your ecosystem across the value chain to overcome the complexities of climate tech adoption, to secure sourcing and to develop new value pools. Don’t forget to thoroughly assess the impact of climate tech adoption on your organization’s existing systems, including impact on overall costs, product performance, reliability, sustainability, and compliance. To support this transition from ideation to factory setup, organizations need a partner with a diverse array of capabilities. Capgemini, with its expertise in prototyping, first-of-a-kind (FOAK) production, and industrial scale-up, is ideally positioned to guide organizations through their transformation to low-carbon technology. Looking for more? Discover a new initiative with the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) to investigate the use of quantum computing in the field of carbon capture. This project provides an opportunity for Capgemini to work alongside the US government to advance sustainability efforts and promote a greener future. Find out how French low-carbon battery giant Verkor is unleashing the power of digitalization in its gigafactory by watching this panel, recorded last month, at Hannover Messe ‘24, the world’s leading industrial fair. And you, what are you saying? How are you approaching climate tech integration? How far along is your organization in reinventing its business models to work toward carbon neutrality? Tell us in the comments section below! emails.body: Thomas C. Durand a partagé un post : Depuis 2020, Didier Raoult parle dru et fort, il accuse beaucoup. Le monde académique se tient coi. Les universités, les instituts, les ministères semblent laisser faire. Un courrier qui vient de fuiter montre qu'en réalité des chercheurs ont donné l'alerte en interne, et ont vite parlé de FRAUDE. Depuis 2023 Didier Raoult évoque un "rapport d'huissier" pour balayer ces accusations. Et ce rapport, justement, nous allons le lire. Vous pourrez vous faire un avis sur la sincérité des données fournies par Raoult & Cie. https://lnkd.in/gn8nX22r Commentaire :https://www.linkedin.com/comm/feed/update/activity:7201173454937595904?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_notification_digest_01%3Bq2hVu4ycTDqaEbV%2FKu3p4Q%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=2DfndL5dC6EHg1&trk=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_NETWORK&trkEmail=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_NETWORK-null-bwd1d4~lwqoqfp9~tl-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-lwqoqfp9-tl&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDcxOGVlYjU4N2NmZDY0MDlhYTc4YjYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjgyNTdjNmNlZmIwMDljYTJkZWJiZTU0ZjAyZDU1NjE1NzcyOWZlMmRkNDI3MjBmNywxLDE%3D Benjamin LOTTIN a commencé à vous suivre Suivre à votre tourhttps://www.linkedin.com/comm/feed/followers?highlightedPublicIdentifiers=benjamin-lottin-8352421b1&highlightedCount=1&lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_notification_digest_01%3Bq2hVu4ycTDqaEbV%2FKu3p4Q%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=2DfndL5dC6EHg1&trk=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-PEOPLE_FOLLOW&trkEmail=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-PEOPLE_FOLLOW-null-bwd1d4~lwqoqfp9~tl-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-lwqoqfp9-tl&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDcxOGVlYjU4N2NmZDY0MDlhYTc4YjYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjgyNTdjNmNlZmIwMDljYTJkZWJiZTU0ZjAyZDU1NjE1NzcyOWZlMmRkNDI3MjBmNywxLDE%3D Armée de l’air et de l’espace a partagé un post : #Actualités 📚 Les élèves de l’École d’enseignement technique de l’armée de l’air et de l’espace (EETAAE), appelés arpètes, suivent une formation militaire pendant leurs deux années de scolarisation. Divisée en trois phases clés, cette formation permet d'obtenir le Certificat d'aptitude militaire (CAM), tout en menant à bien leur formation académique. 👉 La première phase, d'une durée d'un mois, commence après leur incorporation. Les élèves y apprennent les bases de la vie militaire et ses règles, favorisant la cohésion de la nouvelle promotion avant de commencer leurs études académiques. 👉 La deuxième phase se déroule entre juin et juillet et se concentre sur l'apprentissage du combat et des règles d'engagement, de l’armement, etc. En deuxième année, la troisième phase, d’une durée de 10 jours, est axée sur la protection défense. Cette formation est encadrée par des formateurs des bases aériennes de Saintes et Rochefort. 🔎 Pour en savoir plus : https://bit.ly/3wPA43I Voir le post :https://www.linkedin.com/comm/feed/update/ugcPost:7200876600098209793?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_notification_digest_01%3Bq2hVu4ycTDqaEbV%2FKu3p4Q%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=2DfndL5dC6EHg1&trk=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_PAGE&trkEmail=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_PAGE-null-bwd1d4~lwqoqfp9~tl-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-lwqoqfp9-tl&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDcxOGVlYjU4N2NmZDY0MDlhYTc4YjYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjgyNTdjNmNlZmIwMDljYTJkZWJiZTU0ZjAyZDU1NjE1NzcyOWZlMmRkNDI3MjBmNywxLDE%3D EMPLOI: A qui adresser vos candidatures spontanées? emails.subject: 2 choses à te dire
emails.body: # Bonjour Thibault Juste pour te dire deux choses : 1) J'ai rattrapé le retard et hormis 53 emails non-lus qu'il me reste à répondre, je devrais reprendre la routine des emails dès demain ! J'en profiterai pour te donner des conseils à travers 3 emails qui sont liés aux principaux challenges qu'ont eus les 3 membres PJE durant l'immersion. Il y a des chances que tu te sois confronté au même challenge que l'un des 3 participants, donc penses à regarder ta boite email pour ne pas les louper ! 2) Les candidatures pour l'immersion 2025 sont ouvertes et je commence à les traiter ce week-end, si tu veux candidater réponds à cet email. Tu peux également regarder le petit reportage de l'immersion qui vient de se terminer [depuis cette page.](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsDg0fYg0cBpMnKjPFM0ig/RJz5Hf8IileE) Amicalement, Jean P.S : Pour les membres PJE, à ce soir pour le coaching privé ! >Pour ne plus recevoir d'email de ma part et te désinscrire de la newsletter, [clique ici (désinscription immédiate).](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsE8LNl6OyHkX3OYn4KkQk/2U2IoSzP9FzQ) # # Cet e-mail a été envoyé à gting.recrutement@gmail.com Vous avez reçu cet email car vous vous êtes inscrit sur Jean Carrillo. [Se désinscrire](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/un/v2/sh/1t6AVsdYhqSR1mOwTsnsYIkJ6n5KSo/yj_R1uOcimc0) # © Jean Carrillo

Changer de poste, un profil Apec performant,  la création d'entreprise ...
emails.body: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Pour visualiser ce message au format html, cliquez ici : https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d66&e=cDE9JTQwOGlRZWVaOTJHaURvemxvMWFCRXRPWHhDRDZLWnF4Z1dZYnFRVWFKczl2OCUzRA&s=cKhcqvuUocrApfXWktA0h6oPDWzenO2PO7Cx4e6g7M4 ou copiez le lien dans votre navigateur Web ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- LA NEWSLETTER QUI DONNE DE L'ÉLAN À VOTRE AVENIR https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d67 Mai 2024 - Avis d'experte - Et si le moment était venu de changer de poste ? Puisque le marché de l'emploi cadre reste encore aujourd'hui favorable aux candidats et aux candidates, il est temps de vous mettre à l'écoute de vos ambitions professionnelles. Et de trouver (enfin) le job qui vous convient. Je découvre : https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d68 Un profil Apec performant pour être repéré par les recruteurs Quelques éléments attractifs peuvent vous permettre de rendre plus efficace votre profil sur apec.fr. L'objectif : mieux ressortir dans les résultats des recherches effectuées par les recruteurs et attirer leur attention. Je découvre : https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d69 - Le chiffre Waouh ! - 444 Fiches métiers cadres mises à jour ! Allez-vous trouver la vôtre ? https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d6a Débloquez votre situation professionnelle, grâce au CEP Vous vous posez des questions sur votre avenir, réfléchissez à une mobilité, une formation, un projet de reconversion ou d'entreprenariat ? Rencontrez nos expert.es Apec pour des conseils personnalisés et gratuits, adaptés à votre situation professionnelle. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d6b - Il a osé - Il a créé sa boîte Noël souhaitait se lancer dans la création d'entreprise. Pour s'assurer de sa viabilité, il a fait appel à l'Apec. Grégory Grandzamy, consultant à l'Apec de Cergy, a accompagné Noël tout au long de son parcours vers l'entrepreneuriat. Ils vous racontent ensemble cette expérience enrichissante. Voir la vidéo : https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d6c - Agenda - Parler rémunération en entretiens > Webconférence à partir du 30 mai Obtenez les repères nécessaires pour évaluer votre salaire. Disposez des arguments essentiels pour négocier une rémunération conforme à vos compétences. Soyez prêt à aborder le sujet en toute confiance en utilisant le langage commun des recruteurs. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d6d Tout savoir sur le dispositif démission-reconversion > Webilunch mardi 11 juin Démissionner tout en percevant les allocations chômage pour mener à bien un projet de création/reprise d'entreprise ou de formation ? C'est possible avec le dispositif démissionnaire ! Ce webatelier vous informera sur ses modalités et vous aidera à déterminer s'il est adapté à votre situation avant de vous lancer. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d6e Les incontournables pour développer votre carrière > 5 webilunchs la semaine du 3 au 7 juin L'Apec organise des webinaires à l'heure du dej'. Découvrez les 5 thèmes et venez échanger et avoir des conseils pour vous aider à atteindre vos objectifs professionnels. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d6f Valoriser les atouts de son expérience sénior > Webilunch vendredi 7 juin Face à un recruteur, vous avez le sentiment que votre âge est un frein ? Changez de regard sur vos compétences. Apprenez à valoriser vos années d'expérience professionnelle en identifiant les atouts de votre profil senior. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d70 L'immersion en entreprise pour découvrir une nouvelle activité professionnelle > Webconférence le 12 juin Ce webinaire vous permettra de découvrir le dispositif d'immersion professionnelle en vue d'expérimenter un métier ou un secteur d'activité et de confirmer votre projet professionnel grâce à des situations réelles de travail, et d'initier une démarche de recrutement. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d71 - Zoom LinkedIn - Donnez une nouvelle visibilité à votre profil LinkedIn ! On vous délivre nos premiers conseils. https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d72 600 consultant.es Apec vous accompagnent gratuitement Trouvez un centre près de chez vous : https://neomarket.diffusion.apec.fr/r/?id=t1d085d8a,1789cdee,15ba6d73 L'Apec, Association pour l'emploi des cadres, est une organisation paritaire qui se mobilise pour aider les cadres et les jeunes diplômé.es à partir de Bac+3, en particulier les publics les plus fragiles face à l'emploi. En tant qu'opérateur du Conseil en évolution professionnelle (CEP) pour les cadres, l'Apec permet à ses clients, quelle que soit leur situation, de s'informer, réfléchir, se projeter et agir pour leur projet professionnel. En 2023, parmi les 163 000 cadres et jeunes diplômé.es accompagné.es par l'Apec, 96 000 ont bénéficié du CEP. Si vous souhaitez ne plus recevoir d'e-mail de l'Apec concernant l'objet du présent message, cliquez ici.

Fanless Design, Data Security TPM 2.0 Supported, -25 to 70C Wide Operating Temperature, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth included, and MIL-STD-810G 50G Shock 5 GRMS Vibration standard, our Mini PCs are entrusted by some of the largest AI startup in the world. Industrial Monitor Direct is a leading provider of industrial grade touchscreen all-in-one panel PCs for critical visual applications in harsh environments. #automation #MachineVision #robotics #robot #collaborative #technology #manufacturing #collaborativerobot #industrialautomation #factoryautomation #manufacturing Commentaire :https://www.linkedin.com/comm/feed/update/activity:7200173013563039744?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_notification_digest_01%3Bo7%2BtR7XhTsqTOUBc2nEI3Q%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=0eCGKKA5qMArg1&trk=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_NETWORK&trkEmail=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_NETWORK-null-bwd1d4~lwmeevhd~p9-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-lwmeevhd-p9&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDcxOGUxYjE4NmNiZDc0Mzk5YWM4YjYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjhiNzNlNGJjZGM1YWJkZjEyODNlZDdjNWI5ZjIwYmNhMjk5NmMyODBlYjBmYTYwYiwxLDE%3D Armée de l’air et de l’espace a partagé un post : #Actualités Les Couteau Delta sont de retour !   Les équipages de la 3e escadre de chasse de la base aérienne 133 de Nancy-Ochey évoluent notamment sur Mirage 2000D. Cette année, ils se produisent à nouveau en une patrouille de deux chasseurs du nom de Couteau Delta. Cette équipe de démonstration en vol promet prouesses techniques et performances de combat dans un ballet aérien d’une douzaine de minutes. La présentation tactique de ces deux chasseurs bombardiers met en lumière les capacités du Mirage 2000D, constamment engagé en opérations extérieures.  Venez vibrer au son des Mirage 2000D des Couteau Delta dès ce week-end à Gap ! #ArméesNation Voir le post :https://www.linkedin.com/comm/feed/update/share:7199704839851831297?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_notification_digest_01%3Bo7%2BtR7XhTsqTOUBc2nEI3Q%3D%3D&midToken=AQErSc3Sdxmcdw&midSig=0eCGKKA5qMArg1&trk=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_PAGE&trkEmail=eml-email_notification_digest_01-notification_digest-0-SHARED_BY_YOUR_PAGE-null-bwd1d4~lwmeevhd~p9-null-null&eid=bwd1d4-lwmeevhd-p9&otpToken=MTUwNDE3ZTQxYTJkYzBjMGIwMjQwNGVkNDcxOGUxYjE4NmNiZDc0Mzk5YWM4YjYxNzljZjAzNmE0YzVkNTVmMmY3ZDFkZjhiNzNlNGJjZGM1YWJkZjEyODNlZDdjNWI5ZjIwYmNhMjk5NmMyODBlYjBmYTYwYiwxLDE%3D EMPLOI: Epreuve sportive, escape game ou session dans le noir... emails.subject: C'est terminé
emails.body: # Bonjour Thibault J'espère que ton week-end se passe bien. Rapide message pour te dire que le montage vidéo lié à «l'immersion Mai 2024» est terminé... et il est en ligne depuis maintenant ! Tu peux le découvrir depuis cette page : [https://jeancarrillo.com/immersion-mai-2024](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsDg0fYg0cBpMnKjPFM0ig/qU98D27MSPxZ) Spoiler : Dans les prochains mois, ils vont déplacer des montagnes. Bon week end et bon visionnage ! Amicalement, Jean P.S : L'immersion prévue en Novembre 2024 est complète, les seules places disponibles restantes sont pour l'immersion de Mars 2025. Et je préfère t'informer, avec les évènements qui m'arrivent en ce moment dans la vie, il se peut que ce soit la dernière immersion que je fasse (je t'expliquerais la raison d'ici 3-4 mois). P.P.S : Une place est déjà prise pour l'immersion de Mars 2025, donc il en reste que 2 disponibles. Et comme il y a souvent d'anciens participants d'immersion qui reviennent, car ils ont atteint leurs objectifs et veulent passer au niveau supérieur. Il y a de grandes chances qu'une deuxième place soit bloquée rapidement lorsqu'ils verront cet email (comme toi, je les informe à l'instant de l'immersion 2025 via ce mail). Donc si tu veux candidater, [regarde les conditions sur cette page.](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsE8LNl6OyHkX3OYn4KkQk/G1R-2q32tTOT) >Pour ne plus recevoir d'email de ma part et te désinscrire de la newsletter, [clique ici (désinscription immédiate).](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/1t6Af4OiGsEag5xWnKNfhJSOAtJU8o/0GQbMOtbWgXm) # # Cet e-mail a été envoyé à gting.recrutement@gmail.com Vous avez reçu cet email car vous vous êtes inscrit sur Jean Carrillo. [Se désinscrire](https://3mqa4.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/un/v2/sh/1t6AVsdYhqSR1mOwTsnsYIkJ6n5KSo/8b9Q6BW2kMA8) # © Jean Carrillo

emails.subject: Nouvelle position de Chargé de communication H/F dans París
You're invited! | Learn How to Monitor Your Generative AI Tech Stack with Datadog
emails.body: Hi there, Have you considered how your team’s monitoring strategy will adapt to the rapid adoption of artificial intelligence? As the demand for Generative AI grows, optimizing your systems becomes increasingly necessary to scale and maintain competitiveness. However, in doing so, you run the risk of adding complexity and silos to your observability strategy. Join our webinar on Wednesday, June 5th at 3:00pm ET to explore how Datadog enables you to adopt Gen AI with confidence by providing observability for each AI layer: - Infrastructure - Data storage and management - Model serving and deployment - Models - Service chains and applications Please register here reserve your spot See you there! Ryan MacLean Senior Technical Evangelist ©2024 Datadog Inc, 620 8th Ave, 45th Floor, New York, NY 10018 Visit our email preference center to unsubscribe or change subscription options. This email was sent to gting.recrutement@gmail.com.

emails.subject: [NEW] OpenAI GPT-4o is now available on Tabnine Chat
emails.body: We’re thrilled to announce that GPT-4o — the newest and fastest model from OpenAI — is now available on Tabnine Chat ( https://www.tabnine.com/blog/openai-gpt-4o-is-now-available-on-tabnine-chat/ ). You can use the GPT-4o model to power the full capabilities of Tabnine Chat, including code generation, code explanations, documentation generation, AI-created tests, and more. Additionally, when using the GPT-4o model, Tabnine Chat delivers highly personalized recommendations by utilizing the context from locally available data in your IDE. Tabnine Chat now supports the following models:  Tabnine Protected  Tabnine + Mistral  GPT-4o  GPT-4.0 Turbo  GPT-3.5 Turbo More importantly, you’re not locked into any one of these models — you can instantly switch between models for specific projects or use cases. No matter which LLM you choose, you’ll always benefit from the full capability of Tabnine’s highly tuned AI chat agents. Note: OpenAI’s GPT models including GPT-4o are only offered with Tabnine Pro. Now’s a great time to upgrade your account with a special launch price ( https://app.tabnine.com/checkout/purchase-details?promotionCode=PER2024S&planInterval=year&quantity=1 ) of $99/year. Happy coding, — The Tabnine team If you have any questions and can’t find the answers on our FAQ page, reach out to support@tabnine.com - we’re always happy to help. Connect with Tabnine ( https://twitter.com/Tabnine ) ( https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3ZLFXRRmK3XbT5Oq0qPLqA ) ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/tabnine/mycompany/ ) ( https://www.tabnine.com/blog ) The email was sent to gting.recrutement@gmail.com. To no longer receive these emails unsubscribe ( http://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgTRjAYAALmEZbiEZQGPpO7PW3Ow8VDK1JnGqSY= ) here.

Jennifer Loring a partagé un post : As a…
emails.body: Jennifer Loring a partagé un post : As a leading provider of industrial-grade touchscreen all-in-one panel PCs for critical visual applications in harsh environments, Industrial Monitor Direct is proud to offer some of the fastest industrialized Windows PCs on the market, ready for immediate shipment. Our cutting-edge technology is designed to withstand even the most demanding industrial environments, with features such as IP65 waterproof rating, fanless cooling systems with zero moving parts, and ruggedized Panasonic touchscreens that can withstand even the harshest manufacturing environments. Our all-in-one panel PCs are designed for maximum flexibility and performance, available in various sizes and with a wide range of connectivity options, including Ethernet, USB, and serial ports, making them easy to integrate with other equipment and systems. Their user-friendly interface and powerful capabilities make them a valuable addition to any industrial operation. Upgrade your industrial automation and control system with Industrial Monitor Direct today and experience the power of cutting-edge technology and robust performance with the fastest industrialized Windows PCs on the market, ready for immediate shipment.
